conclusion: Determine the velocity v1 of the negatively charged particles when they reach the collection device.
Particles are emitted from point S and move in a uniform magnetic field B, following a circular path due to the Lorentz force.
The radius r of the circular path can be found using the relation r = mv/qB.
Given q/m = 2 x 10^6 C/kg and B = 5 x 10^-3 T.
Particles are emitted from point S at a distance d = 1.2 m above the origin O, and the collection device is on the positive x-axis.
Particles will reach the collection device when their circular path intersects the x-axis.
The radius r is related to the distance d and the angle at which the particle is emitted.
Using the given angle, sin 48.5° = d/r, 0.75 = 1.2/r, r = 1.6 m.
Use the radius r to find the velocity v1: r = mv1/(qB), 1.6 = mv1/10^4, mv1 = 1.6 x 10^4.
Substitute m into the equation: (q/(2 x 10^6)) v1 = 1.6 x 10^4, q v1 = 3.2 x 10^10.
The velocity v1 of the particles when they reach the collection device is 1.6 x 10^4 m/s.
